(rhet.) a kind of poetical composition that can easily be sung.
a man who sings; a singer.
a man who sings the praise of another (esp. one appointed for this purpose).
the act, manner of singing.
a female singer.
the period of light between the sunrise and sunset.
the plant Zingiber cassumunnar of Zingiberaceae family.
its rhizome.
a kind of plant.
a kind of physical combat in which both contestants collide each other head on.
a violent fight.
= ಹಾಣಾಹಣಿ.
a sinful act, as transgression of religious, moral rules; a sin.
a small piece of linen, silk or other fabric, usu. square, and used esp. for wiping one's nose, eyes, face, etc.; a hand-kerchief.
the ability to manage (something esp. during critical times).
a particular hold or lock in wrestling.
a particular hold or lock in wrestling.

any of various families of lepidopteran insects active in the daytime, having a sucking mouthpart, slender body, ropelike, knobbed antennae, and four broad, usu. brightly coloured, membranous wings; a butter-fly.
any of winged insects, as coackroach, fly, etc.
any winged insect attracted by a light.
to be very eager or anxious or enthusiastic to do, see, go, etc.; to be raring.
= ಹಾದರಿಗ.
illicit sexual relations one has with a person whom he or she is not married to; adultery.
a woman who indulges in sexual relations with a man not married or with several men for pleasure or money.
(sl.) a term used to abuse a woman.
the tendency of indulging in illicit sexual enjoyments.
the tree Manilkara hexandra ( = Mimusops kauki) of Sapotaceae family.
the tree Pterospermum chelonoides of Sterculiaceae family.
the large-sized, deciduous tree Stereospermum personatum ( = S. chelonoides) of Bignoniaceae family, with imparipinnate leaves and the hard wood of which is used for boat-building purpose.
another tree of the same family Stereospermum suaveolens ( = Bignonia suaveolens).
